direction.raw_text: - FIELD - DAY A PAIR OF FEET drop heavily in frame. THUMP-CRACK! A shoe flies off. The CROWD gasps. Mrs. Moritz collapses WAILING to the ground. Elizabeth drops to her side to comfort her. Victor just stands staring. ANGLE WIDENS to reveal Justine dangling from the noose, neck broken, hands bound and feet still twitching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SAME FIELD - NIGHT Another eerie echo of before: a storm is raging. The body dangles from the scaffold, lashed by wind and rain. Victor looms from the darkness, staring. And then a massive white hand thrusts into frame and grabs his shoulder. Victor whirls and finds himself staring up into the last face he ever expected to see again, the hideous necrotic features bathed in a purple/white GLARE OF LIGHTNING. He SCREAMS as the Creature lashes out, grabs him by the coat, draws him breathlessly closer, inch by inch, eyeball-to- eyeball, grinning his awful rictus grin. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor is speechless with horror. The Creature raises his arm, pointing with an impossibly long and bony finger. Look there. Victor does. LIGHTNING dances in the sky, illuminating Mont Blanc with a crackling halo of electricity... and then the Creature is gone, vanishing like a shadow in the darkness. Victor falls gasping. The awful truth dawning. He rises, gazing at the scaffold, horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screaming now, rushing to the scaffold, throwing his arms around the innocent girl dangling there, sliding down, sinking to his knees, weeping helplessly:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Frankenstein.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God. Oh God! No! NOOOOOOO!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh God. Justine. Forgive me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MANSION - STUDY - DAWN Victor pulls a carved box from a shelf. Opens it. Lying inside in their velvet cradle are a gorgeous pair of Model 1820 Collier flintlock revolvers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor is bundled in a rough coat, packing final supplies on a horse held by Claude. Elizabeth is at his heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rams the rifle into its scabbard, turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor heaves himself into the saddle and rides off. TILT UP to the mountain. Shrouded in snow. Waiting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My mind was not playing tricks. He was there in the storm... gloating over his crimes... challenging me to come.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But why risk yourself? Hasn't this family suffered enough?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've no choice
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If what you say is true, it is a matter for the police!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They've done a fine job. Hanging an innocent for the crime of a fiend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Do you know this man? Is there something between you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know only that he is a killer. And I shall bring back his carcass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A lone horse and rider appear, on his mission of revenge... Victor ascends the mountain. The mountain is brutal and unforgiving. Victor dismounts, leading his horse onto the glacier. A bitter wind blows... They plod on. Searching. Magnificent rugged vistas unfolding before our eyes. Primeval and vast... The horse suddenly spooks. Victor calms him. Staring. Is that a figure down there? He shades his eyes against the cutting sleet. Somebody in the distance. Down there on the snow field. A tiny speck. Watching him. The figure starts running, leaping across the ice with great bounds. Right toward Victor. Victor wrenches the carved box from the saddle bag. The horse bolts. Victor drops to the snow, throws open the box, frantically snatches up the pair of revolvers. He glances up. The figure is gone, vanished in drifts of white. Victor rises with a revolver in each hand, cocks the flintlocks of both, turning slowly around. Gazing at the rocks and crags. Searching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hears nothing but his own voice echoing back... and then FEET CRUNCHING through the snow. He turns. The Creature is running toward him across the glacier with inhuman speed, greatcoat billowing like huge dark wings. Victor raises the first pistol. Hesitates. As frightened and angry as he is, a small part of him pauses to admire the achievement of actually having created life. He pulls the trigger. BOOM! A huge flash of powder, an eruption of smoke. The Creature dodges the shot, still coming. Victor raises the other gun. BOOM! Another flash of smoke. Still the Creature comes. Victor. Frantic. Manually spinning the cylinders, cocking, firing. BOOM! A miss. BOOM! Another miss. Spinning. cocking. Firing. BOOM! BOOM! Spinning. Cocking... ...And the Creature is on him, slapping the pistols clean out of his hands. The guns sail through the air, spinning off across the ice. Victor panics, turns to run... And slips over the edge of the precipice. Victor falls SCREAMING, arms and legs windmilling through a 30-foot drop... and slams bodily into a snowdrift. He looks up. The Creature is peering down... and leaps over the edge to follow, sailing through the air to land before him in a cat-like crouch. He pulls Victor from the snow and sends him sliding across the ice with a mighty heave...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ICE CAVE - DAY ...right into the mouth of an ice-cave, Victor comes tumbling and sliding down the entrance, spinning and careening to sprawl heavily to the cave floor. Winded. Battered. Barely able to move. He glances up to see the cave filled with possessions. Books. Provisions. Extra clothing. The embers of a fire burn low. There is even a rough attempt at furnishings in the form of a few crates. A huge shadow fills the cave entrance. The storybook ogre is coming home to his cave, breath huffing like a steam engine. Victor scrambles back terrified, pressing into a corner as the Creature enters... ...but the Creature merely crosses to the fire and hunkers down. He tosses a few more sticks on the flames. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature grabs Victor's journal off the "shelf." He unwinds the thong, the letters spill out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He draws closer still. Intimate. Turning his head this way and that. Puzzling at Victor's face. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises his hand before Victor's eyes, bony fingers curling to clutch an invisible throat. Victor is petrified
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Come warm yourself if you like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You speak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I speak. And read. And think... and know the ways of Man. (pause) I've been waiting for you. Two months now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did you find me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The letters in your journal. That and a geography book. (picks up a letter) Your Elizabeth sounds lovely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kill me and have done with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kill you? Hardly that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why am I here? What did you want with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: More to the point, why am I here? What did you want with me? (off Victor's look) What does one say to one's Maker, having finally met him face to face? Milton gave it voice. (grabs a book, thumbs to a certain page) Did I request thee, Maker, from my clay to mould me Man? Did I solicit thee from Darkness to promote me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine words from a child killer. You who murdered my brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your crime... as well as mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How dare you. You're disgusting and evil.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Evil? (scurries closer) Do you believe in evil?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see it before me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure I believe. But then I had no one to instruct me. I had no mother... and my father abandoned me at birth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Were the dying cries of your brother music in my ears?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I took him by the throat with one hand... lifted him off the ground. And slowly crushed his neck. (emotion growing) That poor, innocent child died in my grip... because all I could see was your face... and all I could feel was my rage. And when I let him go, he fluttered to the grass like a sparrow...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : FIELD The Creature gazes down at Willie's body. He stares at the hand that committed the crime as if waking from a dream. Tears welling. Overcome with shame and horror. He falls to knees in the middle of the vast field, his wail echoing across the countryside as he weeps over the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor stares in horror as the Creature relates his story with tears shining in his monstrous eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Later, when they were searching, I followed the pretty lady who got lost in the woods...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : - BARN Justine is asleep in the hay. Haggard, wet, exhausted. The Creature looms over her, a monstrous shape backlit by the lightning, gazing on her beauty. His hand reaches down, hovering reverently, wishing to caress the swell of her breasts at the neckline of her bodice ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The locket drops from his hand to dangle in his fingers. He lowers it, tucking it gently away in her pocket
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) She was so lovely. I longed to touch her... and seek her sympathy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ...but I simply returned the object which had triggered my crime, hoping in some small way to atone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Now tears are shining in victor's eyes as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor is crushed by remorse. A sob escapes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He grabs up the recorder, plays a brief snatch of melody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature moves off. Victor is emotionally exhausted
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You gave me these emotions, but you didn't tell me how to use them. Now two people are dead. Because of us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why, Victor? Why? What were you thinking?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There was something at work in my soul which I do not understand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What of my soul? Do I have one? Or was that a part you left out? (spreads his hands) Who were these people of which I am comprised? Good people? Bad people?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Materials. Nothing more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're wrong. Do you know I knew how to play this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In which part of me did this knowledge reside? In these hands? In this mind? In this heart? (beat) And reading and speaking. Not things learned... so much as things remembered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Trace memories in the brain, perhaps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stolen memories. Stolen and hazy. They taunt me in my dreams. I've seen a beautiful woman lying back and beckoning for me to love her. Whose woman was this? I've seen boys playing, splashing about in a stream. Whose childhood friends were these? (soft, intense) Who am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hollow) I don't know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then perhaps I believe in evil after all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What can I do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is something I want. (pause) A friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Friend?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A companion. A female. Like me, so she won't hate me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Like you? Oh, God, you don't know what you're asking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do know that for the sympathy of one living being, I would make peace with all. (beat) I have love in me the likes of which you can scarcely imagine. And rage the likes of which you would not believe. If I cannot satisfy the one, I will demonically indulge the other. That choice is yours. (off his look) You're the one who set this in motion, Frankenstein.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if I consent?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'd travel north, my bride and I. To the furthest reaches of the Pole, where no man has ever set foot. There we would live out our lives. Together. (beat) No human eye would ever see us again. This I vow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on Victor. Considering it. Beaten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MONT BLANC GLACIER - NEXT MORNING Victor is calming his skittish horse as the Creature looms into view. Victor turns. The Creature tosses Victor his journal. Victor hesitates, jams it into his saddlebag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And with that, the Creature turns and scrambles back down the nearly-vertical cliff face, leaping from crags and boulders with superhuman agility. Victor watches him vanish from sight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Soon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I want this over and done with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be waiting. And watching.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MONT BLANC - DAY Victor descends the mountain, heading back to civilization.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FRANKENSTEIN ESTATE - DAY Victor walks his horse toward the house. Elizabeth rushes out to meet him with Henry and Claude. Victor hands off the reins to the STABLEBOY and embraces Elizabeth tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor glances over. Claude has pulled the Collier pistols from the saddlebags and caught a strong whiff of powder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor walks on toward the house with Elizabeth
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I thought I'd never see you again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm all right. I'm safe,
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened up there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't find what I was looking for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you find?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These have been fired.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At shadows. My nerves got the better of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - GARDEN - DAY ...and we find them in discussion by the fountain:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans forward to kiss her... and pauses, hearing the distant MUSIC of a recorder echoing from the hills...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What sort of task?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not something I can explain now. Perhaps someday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What of our marriage? Victor, we've had so much tragedy. I want this family to live again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So do I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We need each other now, I need your comfort and strength, not separation and solitude.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A month at most, that's all I ask. (draws close) Elizabeth, please. Things have not yet resolved. I must take steps to see that they do. For our family's sake. For our sake. (caresses her face) You are life itself. We shall seal our vow. The moment I am done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BEDROOM - DAY Victor sits at bedside, holding Father's hand. The old man is a weak and frail shadow of his former self.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father smiles faintly. Victor squeezes his hand, whispers:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You must regain your strength to preside at our wedding... and spoil your grandchildren later on. These are duties you cannot shirk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're all safe now. I promise
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MANSION ATTIC - DAY Murky and dark. Victor enters, yanks a dusty curtain off a window to let in some daylight. He picks up a pry bar, approaches a stack of crates as if facing an old adversary. One in particular is quite large. He rams the bar into the wood, prying it open... and CAMERA PUSHES IN to reveal a dull gleam of copper lurking within the packing straw.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: God forgive me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : Victor assembles his equipment, recreating the lab; bolting together the sarcophagus, now resting in its cradle. Hanging the huge glass tube, adjusting the boom. Installing the ceiling tracks and hoist mechanism. Playing out the copper wire along the ceiling beams. Hooking up the galvanic batteries and generators. Testing the electrical circuit with goggles and thick gloves, getting a huge cascade of sparks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor turns. Henry stands in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Henry enters, runs his hand over the gleaming surface of the sarcophagus, circles toward Victor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I prayed never to see these again...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever they are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't bother asking what or why. You wouldn't tell me anyway. I just hope you know what you're doing... (draws close) ...because if this is a repeat of Ingolstadt, I won't be around to pick up the pieces.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: to the Da Vinci print on the wall, contact points still daubed with red...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CEMETERY - NIGHT CAMERA DRIFTS among the tombstones to reveal an eerie sight:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hunched in a grave, digging madly, dirt flying. We hear the THUNK of a shovel hitting wood
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - COFFIN - NIGHT ...and the lid wrenches aside to reveal the Creature. He peers down at us, almost close enough to kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FRANKENSTEIN MANSION - ANGLE FROM ROOF - NIGHT The Creature nimbly climbs the outer wall, fingers grasping the brickwork, a dark shape slung over his shoulder. He pauses as a PAIR OF STABLEHANDS pass far below. He pulls himself onto the roof, crosses the gables, and pushes open a dormer window. We see Victor inside as it swings open. The Creature enters with his prize...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ATTIC - NIGHT ...and the mottled corpse of Justine Moritz flops onto the table before us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor stares down in utter horror. Her cold, dead face. Blue lips already beginning to shrivel. Purple, sunken eyes. Knowing that she loved him. Knowing it's his fault she's dead. He can barely get the words out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it for Victor. He turns away, stomach heaving. It's all he can do to keep from throwing up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor hesitates, pulling himself together. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns back, forcing himself to examine the body, trying not to view it as someone he knows. He cradles the head, probing the back of the neck with his fingers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I want her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why... her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Her body pleases me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Materials, remember? Nothing more. Your words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My words.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The brain stem was destroyed by the hanging. We'll need another. The body looks like it will do, but some extremities are too decayed. They'll have to be replaced. The fresher the better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ALLEY - RED LIGHT DISTRICT - NIGHT Outside the back door of a rowdy tavern, we find a PROSTITUTE servicing a SAILOR in the alley: he's got her pressed against the wall, skirt hiked up. It's not long before he's finished. Off he goes, staggering back into the bar. She arranges her skirt, tucking the money away... and pauses, noticing a TALL FIGURE in the shadows. Staring. She approaches with her best saucy smile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature leans into the light, clamps a massive hand to her mouth. His other arm wraps around her waist, pulling her off the ground. She gazes up, eyes wide, screams muffled in his palm. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he wrenches his arm, snapping her spine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Want some yourself? Or just like to watch? (draws close) What do you say, lover? I can make it good for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ATTIC - NIGHT The dead prostitute lies staring up, dried blood staining her mouth. TILT UP to Victor gazing down in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature lashes out and drags Victor across the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature vanishes out the attic window into the night. Victor is left gasping for air, staring at the dead prostitute. The full horror sinking in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A brain. Extremities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This was not taken from a grave.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does it matter? She'll live again. You'll make her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I draw the line.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will honor your promise to me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (through gritted teeth) I will not! Kill me now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is mild compared to what will come. If you deny me my wedding night. I'll be with you on yours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ATTIC STAIRCASE - MORNING Victor slams the attic door, securing it with a massive padlock. He hurries down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GRAND BALLROOM - DAY Victor and Elizabeth, intensity flying:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No. Not tomorrow, not next week, Marry me today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why the change? What about your work?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was misguided and pointless. Is your answer yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll leave this afternoon, right after the ceremony. Pack only what you need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does this have something to do with that man you saw?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitates) Yes. We're in danger here. Every moment we stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Victor, tell me why! Trust me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do. But you must trust me for now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BEDROOM - DAY A small ceremony has been hurriedly organized at Father's bedside. The old man holds Elizabeth's hand. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He releases her hand, giving the bride away. She takes her place at Victor's side. Henry stands as best man. The PRIEST faces them:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is not... the grand wedding... I had hoped to give you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We gather now in the sight of God to witness this man and woman bond their lives in matrimonial vow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MANSION - DAY Elizabeth gets in the coach. Claude clambers up to the driver's seat armed with a rifle, ready to pull out. EIGHT MEN on horseback provide armed escort. Victor addresses the men staying behind, all of whom are also armed:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Be especially on your guard. Stay cautious to a fault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is this man, sir? How shall we know him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He is huge and deformed... and quite insane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He killed Master William and sent Justine Moritz to the noose! No hesitation, lads! Shoot the bastard on sight!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: of assent. Victor pulls Henry aside:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A quick embrace. Victor leaps into the coach.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure you'll be all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, don't worry. I'll look after your father. You look after her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be back as soon as I've got her far away and safe. We'll hunt this fiend down together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only if you'll tell me who he is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hesitates) I owe you that. Done.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The coach clatters up the road, trailed by the eight horsemen. Those left behind scatter across the courtyard. Henry turns and walks back toward the house. ANGLE WIDENS to reveal the Creature at the window.  In the bed behind him, The old man stirs, opening his eyes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and sees the Creature turn toward him. Father's eyes go wide as his final stroke is triggered. His life ends with a prolonged death-rattle... and a soft exhale. The Creature reaches down, closes his eyes. A tender gesture.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Victor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . The Creature whirls. There stands the priest, dropping his tea to the floor. The Creature sweeps across the room, presses him against the wall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (breathless with horror) You're the Devil himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, and I've come to snatch your soul... (leans close) ...unless you tell me where they've gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - LAKE GENEVA - DUSK A magnificent sunset bathes the mountains as storm clouds roll in. A ferry is crossing the lake, moving away from us, rippling the water. TILT DOWN to reveal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FERRY DOCK - DUSK Claude trotting to the window of the coach.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That was the last ferry. There's nothing else till morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Damn it
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'll ride on ahead and secure you lodging for the night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - RESORT - NIGHT A big chalet nestled in the woods by the lake. The storm is raging. Claude and his men are positioned at the entrances.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Make sure you keep your pistols dry
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #2 They're dry enough. And if they fail, we've others. And if those fail... (draws his saber halfway) ...we can always gut the bastard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, sir. You're well guarded. Now why don't you go upstairs to your wife? It's not often a man has his wedding night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BRIDAL SUITE - NIGHT Victor enters to find the room aglow with dozens of candles. Elizabeth turns from the fireplace, her body silhouetted through the sheer white nightgown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She approaches, peels off his coat. Victor stares at her, awe-struck. She sees the look in his eyes, crosses her arms demurely... then laughs at her own modesty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He strokes her bare shoulders with his fingertips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leans up and gives him a kiss that would melt glass, triggering the sexiest seduction imaginable... ...kissing, caressing, Victor stripping off his wet shirt, CAMERA DRIFTING around them in slow circles, candles spinning like a fever that's been building for a lifetime... and now onto the bed. Magnificent and canopied. Kneeling together, bodies touching, hands seeking, mouths joining... Elizabeth lying back, beckoning for him to love her. Victor sinking down, running his hands up her thighs, peeling up the nightgown, making her shudder with desire... ...and a SHOT FIRES. Victor jerks up. He can hear SHOUTING. He rolls off the bed, snatching up both pistols lying primed and ready on the nightstand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're soaking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Brother and sister no more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now husband and wife.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remember the first time I ever saw you. Crossing the floor of the grand ballroom with my parents at your side. So beautiful even then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a whisper) I have been waiting for this ever since.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Victor!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Open this door for no-one!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CHALET - NIGHT Victor sails past the GUARD at the entrance, brandishing his pistols. The men converge, shouting in the rain:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several men race off in pursuit. TILT UP from Victor and Claude... as a FLASH OF LIGHTNING reveals the Creature clinging in the branches above their heads with a malevolent smile. He scurries  silently up, further and further into the tree... closer and closer to the balcony.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: #2 I saw him in a flash of lightning! He vanished toward the lake!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get after him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BRIDAL SUITE - NIGHT Elizabeth. Tense and waiting. A shadow looms across the balcony... spilling through the French doors... onto the floor... a bony hand reaches for the latch... The doors burst open on a crust of wind and rain, Elizabeth spins as candles blow out all over the room. The Creature enters, massive and unseen, gliding in shadow. Softly:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't bother to scream.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CHALET - NIGHT The men come running back from the lake. They stop before Victor and Claude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And GUARD #4's eyes drift up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor spins, gazing up. Breath catching in his throat. The French doors are swaying in the wind.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: #3 We lost him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #4 Why are those open?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elizabeth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BRIDAL SUITE - NIGHT Elizabeth watches, transfixed, as the huge shadow moves inexorably toward her. Her eyes dart toward the door. She makes a break for it. He catches her halfway across the room, spinning her around by the arm. Her face is lit by the light of the fireplace. The Creature pauses, stunned at her beauty. A moment passes between them. She senses the softening in his heart. She peers at him, trying to understand. Realizing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He averts his gaze, shamed by her beauty.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You don't want to hurt me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're more lovely than I could ever have imagined.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: come pounding up the stairs. A HEAVY CRASH of men throwing their shoulders at the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and it changes back in an instant, The Creature snarls. She tries to wrench away. He spins her around so he won't have to look at her in the light, casting her face in shadow. He cooks his arm back and plunges his fist toward her chest with pile-driver force...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LANDING (OUTSIDE ROOM) - NIGHT ...and her SCREAM is cut short. The men give one last mighty rush at the door...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BRIDAL SUITE - NIGHT ...and they burst in just in time to see Elizabeth cascade back onto the bed, her chest a massive red stain. The Creature whips toward them, fist glistening with blood...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and he races across the room as the men OPEN FIRE, shredding the walls to splinters with an explosive fusillade of shots. But the Creature is too fast. He hits the leaded window head-on with the force of an anvil...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I keep my promises.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CHALET - NIGHT ...and goes sailing out into empty space in a hurricane of shattering glass. He drops 40 feet to the grass below and vanishes like the breeze, greatcoat whipping into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BRIDAL SUITE - NIGHT Victor rushes to the bad and lets loose the most PRIMAL SCREAM OF ALL. He sweeps his limp, murdered bride into his arms, cradling her to his breast, screams trailing off into wracking moans and sobs of despair:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Oh God... he took her heart... he took her heart from me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - CHALET - NIGHT The men make way as Victor carries his dead wife through the downpour. He puts her in the coach. Dazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ROAD - NIGHT The coach comes racing through the storm, the horses in a frenzy, faster and faster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MANSION - NIGHT Victor whipping the coach veers to a wild stop. Victor jumps down, gathers up the body, and mounts the steps. Henry appears, rushing out into the rain. Victor goes right past him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and carries Elizabeth through the silent halls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The door swings in. Victor stands dripping. Holding Elizabeth. Gazing at the gleam of copper...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : And we launch into the final throbbing madness. Victor hacking and chopping. Discarding pieces. Sewing the creation, yanking the catgut tight. Ramming the needles deep. Hoisting the body in the air. Slamming the sarcophagus lid, tightening the bolts. Powering up the galvanic circuit, throwing the switch. Screaming at God as the LIGHTNING FLASHES and the body convulses. Wind and rain sweeping through the lab, battering a window open and shut, open and shut. Lowering the glass tube, ramming phallus into womb. Releasing the eels, huge black sperm squirming and writhing toward the spasming egg The body. Convulsing. Lashing. Screaming in the copper womb. Hair whipping in the fluid... Victor shuts down the machinery. He opens the tank and reaches into the fluid with his thick rubber gloves. He pulls out his creation, cradling the head and neck as one would cradle a newborn infant's... ...And wipes the muck away with his glove to reveal Elizabeth's face, Massive suture marks bisect her neck and collarbone where pieces were joined. A whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes flies open as consciousness hits, mouth gaping to draw air but finding fluid in the lungs. She erupts, thrashing in the vat. He clutches her tight, pounding her back to start her breathing, calming the convulsing Creaturess with soft murmured words of tenderness and love as her lungs heave violently to dispel the fluid... He lifts her gently out. Wipes off the muck as she shivers and shakes, spasms easing off. Cleansing her face. Clasping her hand in his. Comfort and strength... Helping her to her feet. Jerky and unsure. Lean on me. Replacing the sheer nightgown on her scarred and naked body, draping it... and finally, exhaustingly, tilting her chin up with his fingers to gaze into her eyes. A whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blank. Dazed. Stunned. Not a flicker of recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing. He leans forward... and kisses her dead lips. Gentle as a sigh. A flicker in her eyes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe his imagination. Still whispering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And slowly... ever so slowly... she raises her bony white hand before her eyes... staring at it... trying to puzzle it out... its meaning... perhaps the vaguest shred of recognition... and the hand continues to rise... creeping slowly toward his shoulder... and coming to rest there. He smiles, blinking back tears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he takes her other hand in his. At first it's imperceptible... just the slightest motion, perhaps nothing, perhaps just a shift of balance... and then it grows into the vaguest sway... and tears are glistening in Victor's eyes as she begins to move. Lurching. Faltering. Unsure. You must lead, Victor. The lady will always look to you for guidance, so your steps must be sure and strong. Trace memories. A waltz. And here we are treated to the most sweepingly romantic and hair-raisingly demented image of the film: Frankenstein dances with his dead bride, showing her the way, begging her to remember, please remember, and now our WALTZ/LOVE THEME really comes back to haunt us as the MUSIC SWELLS, incredibly lush and deranged, dissonant and echoing through Victor's head, music only he can hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and the worst part? The very worst thing of all? There on the shelf. A large formaldehyde jar. Justine's severed head. Watching them through the glass with dead, sightless eyes. Watching them dance. Still a wallflower? No. She's finally finishing her dance with Victor... most of her, anyway. Under the circumstances, it'll have to do... ...and the waltz goes on, madder and madder, sweeping in glorious circles as a dazzling array of LIGHTNING bathes them in its wild, jittering spotlight, shadows careening across the walls, INSANE MUSIC swelling louder and louder, climbing higher and higher, reaching toward its crescendo with jagged glass claws... ...and it all screeches to a stop as the door bursts in. Music echoes abruptly away into silence. Nothing now but rain and distant thunder. In the doorway:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature raises his hand. Beckoning. She takes a faltering step. Drawn to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her face reflects horror and shame, like a brain-damaged child who's wet the bed. She knows she's supposed to remember... but can't remember what remembering means. They both motion to her. Murmuring. Begging. She's caught between them, pulled like a diaphanous rope in a tug of war. Please... come with me. Please... remember. She finally tilts toward the Creature. Gazing into his eyes. Studying his face. Fingertips tracing his massively scarred flesh. A beat. A frown. A puzzlement. This isn't right. People don't look like this. They're not stitched together out of pieces of flesh like a patchwork. She looks at her own hands. Dead and white. Not even hers. One belongs to Justine. Another to a prostitute, suture scars marring the wrist. She looks down at herself. The dead, sagging breasts. The body that isn't hers either. Realization creeping into her eyes. Realization and horror. Turning to Victor. Why do I look like this? What's happened to me? Oh God, what's happened to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and she lets out a SHRIEK, a banshee wail from the deepest pits of hell. Screaming at them both. Screaming at herself. She goes berserk, trying to claw her flesh away, trying to find the real Elizabeth underneath the horror, trying to peel it away, clawing at her face. Trying to claw out her own eyes. Victor lunges to restrain her, screaming himself, veering toward final utter madness like strings snapping on a violin. The Creature grabs him, hurls him aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. She remembers. Not much, but enough. She breaks away from them as they grapple, still SHRIEKING as she sails across the room, tipping furniture, equipment flying... ...over straight to the kerosene lamp, snatching it up before they can stop her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She spins to face them, holding them breathlessly at bay with the threat of the lamp, twitching from one to the other. But it's not just the lamp, it's the look of sheer loathing in her eyes. Loathing for them for what they've done to her... loathing for herself for what she's become. It turns out the lady does know her own mind. She wants no part of it... or them. Decision made. She crushes the lamp in her bare hands, drenching herself in a cascade of kerosene. WHOOOOSH! She goes up like a blazing matchstick and darts past them, still SHRIEKING, still trying to claw the dead flesh away, pulling off giant flaming pieces of herself as she careens out the door and down the steps, Victor and the Creature racing after her...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Live.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say my name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elizabeth. Say my name. Say you remember. Say my name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must. You must.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say my name. Say you remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I'll help you remember.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...one-two-three, twirl-two-three.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She's not for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sure the lady knows her own mind. Doesn't she? Let her decide the proper suitor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Elizabeth, no! (she turns, puzzled) Say my name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vic... tor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! SHE'S MINE!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! SHE SAID MY NAME! SHE REMEMBERS!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - UPPER HALLWAY - NIGHT ...and she sails down the hallway, setting FIRE to everything she passes, SCREAMING for the final torment to end. She hurls herself over the railing, drapes catching ablaze as she plummets to the floor far below. A pillar of flame leaps up on impact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: face each other as flames sweep the walls, combusting the upper hallway into a raging tunnel in Hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurls himself at the Creature, who backhands him spinning down the hallway, sprawling to the floor. The Creature gazes down at his Maker one last time...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then vanishes through the smoke and flames.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You killed her! You killed her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We killed her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - FRANKENSTEIN ESTATE - DAY The once-magnificent estate lies in smoldering ruin beneath a merciless gray sky. Charred beams and drifting smoke are all that remain to mark the passing of a noble family. Victor stands gazing at the house. A windswept, hollow man Bundled in a rough coat. Flintlock rifle dangling at his side. Henry moves into frame some distance behind. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No reaction. For a long moment it seems Victor hasn't heard. He rouses as if from a trance, turn and walks to his pack horse. The animal stands saddled and ready. He starts to mount up, but Henry intercepts him with a restraining hand. Victor snaps a look as if seeing a stranger... and then his features soften.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor pauses, emotions swirling. Wishing he could grab the dangling thread of sanity Henry has offered... but knowing the thread is a bittersweet illusion. A bare whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor abruptly heaves himself into the saddle and spurs his horse. Henry runs after him, shouting:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Victor keeps riding without so much as a backward glance. The past is dead. Henry watches Victor until he's gone from sight, as Willie did so long ago...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Victor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All that I once loved lies in a shallow grave. By my hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let it go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You should have been my father's son. He would have been so proud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! COME BACK!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - MONT BLANC GLACIER - DAY The solitary rider and his mount traverse the windswept glacier ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE CREATURE'S CAVE - DAY Victor slides down the entrance, rifle cradled. The cave is now deserted, all possessions gone, a scorched black spot where the campfire had been...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - GLACIER - DAY A panorama of snow. Pristine... save for the long trail of footprints stretching off before us. Victor's face thrusts into frame, gazing at the craggy horizon, breath punching the air with billows of vapor. He slogs onward, following the tracks, leading his horse by the reins. Dwindling across the frozen landscape.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I followed his trail north... always north... and always one step behind... never stopping... driven by my fires of rage... and revenge...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - WALTON'S CABIN - TWILIGHT Victor lies in Walton's bed, sallow as a corpse, barely able to speak, drained now of everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walton takes Victor's hand, lays it gently back to his chest. Softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor is silent. His breathing shallow. Walton just sits And waits...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A year now I've followed him. Perhaps more. Only to arrive at this place. Tired. So very tired. I never did find... whatever it was... I was looking for... and neither will you, my friend. (off Walton's look) Value life above ambition... or those glittering prizes you seek will crumble to dust in your fingers... as they have in mine. (reaches out feverishly) See your loved ones again. I cannot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rest now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: marks the passage of Walton's long vigil... Victor's eyes flutter open as if staring at something unseen. Perhaps, the faces of those he loved. The eyes glaze. A peaceful death. Walton rises. Puts on his heavy coat to ward off the chill. Exits the cabin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NEVSKY - ON DECK - TWILIGHT Grigori is leaning on the gunwale, staring off across the ice. His coat is open. Walton joins him. Surprised at how warm it is. He holds up his hand, testing the breeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grigori moves off to gather help. Walton turns and heads back to his cabin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: A warming wind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This ice will break yet. (glances over) How's our guest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He died. Raving about phantoms. He was mad, poor devil. (beat) Gather a detail. Have the body removed from my cabin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Aye, Captain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - WALTON'S CABIN - NIGHT Walton enters... and freezes at the sound of SOFT WEEPING. He can't see the bad from here. Could it be the dead man? He glances down. Wet footprints lead across the floor. He eases forward. The tiny bed chamber comes slowly into view. A DARK FIGURE is hunched and weeping at bedside, holding the corpse's hand. Walton is stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The figure swivels its head, revealing its face to the dim yellow light:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walton hisses a terrified intake of breath. He lunges to the desk, slaps his hand on the pistol lying there. A frozen beat. Wondering if he should snatch it up. Eyes dancing with fear and speculation. The Creature makes no move. Unconcerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walton glances to the porthole, ajar and creaking in the breeze, chilled at the thought. The Creature returns his gaze to Victor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature gently strokes Victor's cheek. He reaches up with two fingers, closes the staring eyes. A whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question goes unanswered. The Creature rises, gliding in shadow to the door. Pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then the Creature is gone, vanishing smoothly into the night...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He never gave me a name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were with him at the end.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (finds his voice) Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was watching.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I longed to be with him. But I wanted his final moments to have peace. I could see you were a friend to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is that to you? Evil as you are.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (swivels his gaze) I am as he made me. In his own image.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You drove him to his torment.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And he drove me to mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why weep for him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you not? He was father. And mother. We fell from grace together. He from his God. I from mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could we ever have forgiven?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've never been shown a kindness. Show me one now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kindness?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Build for him a pyre. Light up the sky with his passing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ARCTIC - TWILIGHT The crew of the Nevsky are on the ice, chopping up the fallen mast, axes rising and falling in waves...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ARCTIC - TWILIGHT The body of Victor Frankenstein lies on an impressive bier of wood, stacked and lashed. His body is wrapped in rough canvas, his face as dead and white as the ice. Walton and crew stand facing the bier. Walton silently reads a passage from the Bible. Oily black smoke from a small campfire drifts past. Walton closes the book. Amens are muttered. Walton glances to Grigori and nods. Grigori moves forward with two other men. They begin dousing the pyre with lamp oil, soaking it. Walton moves to the campfire, picks up an unlit torch. He dips it into the fire, igniting the pitch, turns. The men back away, preparing for the coming blaze... ...and a dog starts howling on deck, others joining in. The men pause. Gazing across the ice. Dread seeping into their bones. There's a figure out there. Huge and humanlike in frame. Loping slowly over the ice. Approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grigori snatches up the rifle, shoulders it smoothly, cocks the flintlock. Walton glances over, pushes the muzzle skyward, denying his aim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grigori hesitates, nods. If you say so. The men grow more unsettled as the Creature draws nearer. Frightened muttering. Men start backing toward the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men stand fast. The Creature stops some thirty yards out. A silent tableau on the ice. The men facing the Creature. Walton holding the torch. The pyre waiting for the kiss of flame. Walton moves forward... ...and a THUNDEROUS CRACK is heard, The men whip their heads as a gigantic plate of ice goes spinning into the air some fifty yards away and comes crashing back down again. It's like tectonic plates building pressure toward an earthquake: once it goes, it goes with terrifying speed and force: CRACK! Another eruption. CRACK! And another. CRACK! Ice cascading skyward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walton rushes forward. CRACK! The ice erupts before him. The torch goes flying. Walton sprawls flat on his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men don't have to be told twice. They're already in full retreat, scrambling for their lives. Ice is detonating for miles around as if pounded by artillery. Grigori helps Walton to his feet. The torch lies burning not ten feet away. A heartbeat of hesitation. Walton wondering if he should go for it. Grigori pulling wildly on his sleeve...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and then the matter is decided for them as a huge rift opens at their feet, running an explosive zig-zag course across the ice, separating them from the torch. They fall back to join the retreat, stumbling after the others, pursued by the ice dissolving at their heels.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Christ.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It has a right to bear witness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stand fast. All of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: OLD SAILOR THE BITCH IS BREAKIN' UP

dialogue.raw_text: (whips toward Walton)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: watches his last wish for Victor Frankenstein snatched away by God's whim and breaking ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts forward. Behind him, a detonation of ice throws a massive fist into the air, creating a magnificent halo of cascading water and spinning fragments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first wave of fleeing men reach the ship, crowding to the drop-net for salvation, scrambling up the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stumble along, closing distance to the ship. Walton glances back, amazed to see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: racing across the ice, making for the torch, teeth set in a wide grimace of effort. Detonations threaten to swallow him from all sides. Suddenly, things go from bad to worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: breaks free with an enormous groan, heeling slowly over, triggering massive eruptions in all directions. The crew hang onto the drop-net for dear life. Several men plummet into the icy water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is propelled by a detonation as if held stepped on a land mine, cartwheeling helplessly through the air to plunge headfirst into the water, huge plates of spinning ice crashing down after him. Gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are knocked flat as a fissure appears between them. Grigori, dazed, is lifted into the air on a teetering table of ice, desperately trying to scramble back but sliding forward nonetheless, rising up and up, a gaping maw of frigid water yawning wider and wider before him. Walton grabs the back of Grigori's coat and tries to drag him off... but the coat is snatched from his fingers as the ice see-saws forward in a complete flip and slams Grigori thunderously into the drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: finishes righting itself, swaying ponderously as she finds honest ocean beneath her hull. Some men are reaching the top of the net, hurling themselves over the gunwale to the deck. Those lower on the drop-net are helping their fellows from the water, hauling them to safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is now corkscrewing in slow circles on its own ice floe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is drifting on a chunk of ice. Still burning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: AT WATER LEVEL Walton is on hands and knees, scrambling on shifting pieces of ice, thrusting his arms into the water, screaming:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first mate breaks surface in the foreground, gasping and strangling for breath, face already turning blue, arms thrashing wildly, dragged down by the now-impossible weight of his own clothing. Walton strains to reach him, nearly going into the water himself. Grigori keeps thrashing and gasping. Dying. He's dying right in front of Walton's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too late. Grigori goes down for the final time, vanishing for good beneath the frigid water. Gone. Walton throws his head back with a bellow of anguish... ...and Grigori breaks the surface again, rising slowly And impossibly from the water. arms and legs windmill against the air, propelled from below with nearly aulic strength. He gazes down in shock at the massive fist clutching his chest... and the arm that grows and grows, rising, lifting him up and up... and the hideous face that breaks the surface beneath him. The face of a nightmare. The Creature lunges hugely, hurling Grigori through the air right into Walton's arms. Both men go sprawling. Walton scrambles to his knees, makes eye contact with the Creature. The monster is exhausted. Near his limit. Walton thrusts out his arm, fingers grasping to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Creature swivels his gaze. The burning torch is drifting away. He looks grimly back to Walton. Walton beckoning to him. Come. Grab my hand. The Creature swims away, knifing through the water after the torch. Walton turns, drags Grigori gasping to his feet, helps him limp toward the Nevsky across the lurching ice.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WALTON SOMEBODY THROW ME A GAFF

dialogue.raw_text: Swim.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: struggles through the water, crushed and battered by ice floes on all sides. Going under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slog grimly on across the disintegrated ice, knee-deep and nearly walking on water. They sink, finding nothing beneath their feet. Lines are thrown down and caught. Walton and Grigori are hauled from the frigid arctic water and hoisted up the side of the ship. The last ones aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is spinning slowly on its chunk of ice. Bony fingers break the surface of the water. A straining hand. The Creature's eyes rise from the murk. Bleary with exhaustion and cold. He seizes the torch. Raises it high. Swims grimly on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crew bundle Walton and Grigori in blankets, both men shivering with exposure. Walton lurches to the gunwale, gazing off. The men crowd to his-side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: swims on, head barely breaking the water, torch held high to keep it burning. Relentlessly determined. This is the most grueling effort we've ever seen. Gasping and sinking beneath the surface... ...and finally grasping with frozen fingers the ice floe upon which lies Frankenstein's funeral pyre. He hauls himself from the water. Moving now in a slow-motion litany of exhaustion. Climbing the pyre. Scaling the wood. Seeking the top. Never giving up. The Creature joins his Maker atop the bier, straddling the wood, holding the torch aloft as if lighting his master's way to the Netherworld, Frankenstein's personal boatman across the River Styx. Frankenstein himself lies serenely at his creation's knees, content to be shown the way... The Creature turns his face to the sky, gulping air, spreading his arms wide in sublime triumph. Feeling the wind on his skin, the sleet on his face, the grim joy in his heart. Cold. So very cold. He glances at the torch burning low in his outstretched hand, pitch almost gone, sputtering and trailing smoke. He looks down. At Frankenstein. The oil-soaked canvas. The saturated wood. There's that smell. Yes. He scoops Victor up with his free arm and cradles him to his breast, as tender as a mother comforting a baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gaze in horror. Realization dawning:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Don't do it... (screaming)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! DON'T DO IT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: turns his gaze one last time toward Heaven. Eyelids fluttering in near-religious ecstasy. Finding in these last moments the sympathy held so long sought. A whisper:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he rams the torch into the pyre beneath him. White-hot ignition. Ultimate redemption. WHUMP! A massive BALL OF FLAME engulfs the bier, pushing a huge fiery fist into the sky. Blossoming. Roiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: For God's sake... I will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: gaze on in wonder and horror as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rides the burning pyre, a shrieking revenant wrapped in a caul of fire, screaming in the flames. Hair going up at a sizzling flashpoint. Cheeks billowing out, peeling back in the blast-furnace heat. Flesh cleansing from bone. Teeth charring and turning black. Still cradling Victor. Still screaming. waiting for the final torment to end. Perhaps it never will...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drifts off into the arctic twilight trailing a huge column of flame and smoke, inhuman screams echoing endlessly. Lost in the darkness and distance.
direction.name: direction
